page.title: 17CHANGING EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The main type of employment in Collier Street is farming.Fewer people work on farms now because not so many apples need picking and hops are picked by machine.About 25% of women in Collier Street work on farms.Until 1968 the owner of a farm would also own tied cottages,lived in by his employees.If these employees lost their jobs they would also lose their cottage. Collier Street is becoming a commuter village. The Journey to London takes about 1 and a half hours.The business man usually leaves at 7 am. and arrives home at 7pm.Commuters live in Collier Street because it is a peaceful,uncrowded and interesting community.Some of the occupations of the commuters are ... environmental health officers,plumbers, fashion designers,wholesale fish merchant,and agricultural lecturers.
